title: How to Make Indian Milk Cake or Kala Kand

steps.headline: Add milk powder, cardamom powder, tartaric acid, citric acid and sugar in a frying pan.
steps.description: Fry on very low flame/heat level.

steps.headline: Add the powdered milk and 1 tablespoon of ghee.
Stir continuously to avoid charring of the mixture.
Add one more tablespoon of ghee.
steps.description: Mix by continuously stirring the mixture with the spatula.

steps.headline: Keep stirring till there is a change in the color of the mixture.
steps.description: This should be done on a low flame/heat level only.

steps.headline: Increase the gas flame and keep stirring for few more minutes.
Cook till ghee leaves the sides of the mixture.
Continue the above step till all the liquid is evaporated.
Pour the contents onto a plate.
Press the cake mixture firmly with the spatula.
steps.description: Press in such a manner that the height of the mixture is not more than 3xm/7.5".

steps.headline: Cut into desired shapes after 30 minutes.

text: Cooking the Cake Add milk powder, cardamom powder, tartaric acid, citric acid and sugar in a frying pan. Fry on very low flame/heat level. Add the powdered milk and 1 tablespoon of ghee.  Stir continuously to avoid charring of the mixture.  Add one more tablespoon of ghee. Mix by continuously stirring the mixture with the spatula. Keep stirring till there is a change in the color of the mixture. This should be done on a low flame/heat level only. Increase the gas flame and keep stirring for few more minutes.  Cook till ghee leaves the sides of the mixture.  Continue the above step till all the liquid is evaporated.  Shaping and Serving the Cake Pour the contents onto a plate.  Press the cake mixture firmly with the spatula. Press in such a manner that the height of the mixture is not more than 3xm/7.5". Cut into desired shapes after 30 minutes.
